_README.usage: Models listed here are exposed through OpenRouter. Aliases are case-insensitive.

field_descriptions.model_name: The model identifier - OpenRouter format (e.g., 'anthropic/claude-opus-4') or custom model name (e.g., 'llama3.2')
field_descriptions.aliases: Array of short names users can type instead of the full model name
field_descriptions.context_window: Total number of tokens the model can process (input + output combined)
field_descriptions.max_output_tokens: Maximum number of tokens the model can generate in a single response
field_descriptions.supports_extended_thinking: Whether the model supports extended reasoning tokens (currently none do via OpenRouter or custom APIs)
field_descriptions.supports_json_mode: Whether the model can guarantee valid JSON output
field_descriptions.supports_function_calling: Whether the model supports function/tool calling
field_descriptions.supports_images: Whether the model can process images/visual input
field_descriptions.max_image_size_mb: Maximum size in MB for each individual image (0 = no per-image limit documented). Capped at 40MB for custom models.
field_descriptions.max_image_count: Maximum number of images per request (None/omit = no fixed count limit). Based on provider official docs.
field_descriptions.max_total_image_size_mb: Maximum total size in MB for all images combined (0 = no total limit). Validation checks original file size. NOTE: Some providers (e.g. Anthropic 32MB, Google 15MB) account for base64 encoding overhead and text content in their API limits. Capped at 40MB for custom models.
field_descriptions.supports_temperature: Whether the model accepts temperature parameter in API calls (set to false for O3/O4 reasoning models)
field_descriptions.temperature_constraint: Type of temperature constraint: 'fixed' (fixed value), 'range' (continuous range), 'discrete' (specific values), or omit for default range
field_descriptions.use_openai_response_api: Set to true when the model must use the /responses endpoint (reasoning models like GPT-5 Pro). Leave false/omit for standard chat completions.
field_descriptions.default_reasoning_effort: Default reasoning effort level for models that support it (e.g., 'low', 'medium', 'high'). Omit if not applicable.
field_descriptions.intelligence_score: 1-20 human rating used as the primary signal for auto-mode model ordering
field_descriptions.allow_code_generation: Whether this model can generate and suggest fully working code - complete with functions, files, and detailed implementation instructions - for your AI tool to use right away. Only set this to 'true' for a model more capable than the AI model / CLI you're currently using.
field_descriptions._limits_source: Official documentation URL for image limits
field_descriptions._limits_verified: Date when limits were verified against official docs (YYYY-MM-DD)

models.description: Claude Sonnet 4.5 - High-performance model with exceptional reasoning and efficiency
models._limits_note: Messages API: 100 images, 5MB per image. 24MB original size limit to ensure base64-encoded payload (~32MB after +33% encoding) stays within API's 32MB request limit (includes text, images, and all parameters).

models.description: Claude Opus 4.1 - Our most capable and intelligent model yet
models._limits_note: Messages API: 100 images, 5MB per image. 24MB original size limit to ensure base64-encoded payload (~32MB after +33% encoding) stays within API's 32MB request limit (includes text, images, and all parameters).

models.description: Claude Sonnet 4.1 - Last generation high-performance model with exceptional reasoning and efficiency
models._limits_note: Messages API: 100 images, 5MB per image. 24MB original size limit to ensure base64-encoded payload (~32MB after +33% encoding) stays within API's 32MB request limit (includes text, images, and all parameters).

models.description: Claude 3 Haiku - Fast and efficient with vision
models._limits_note: Messages API: 100 images, 5MB per image. 24MB original size limit to ensure base64-encoded payload (~32MB after +33% encoding) stays within API's 32MB request limit (includes text, images, and all parameters).

models.description: Google's Gemini 3.0 Pro via OpenRouter with vision
Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro via OpenRouter with vision
models._limits_note: 3000 images/prompt, 7MB per image. 15MB original size limit to ensure base64-encoded payload (~20MB after +33% encoding) stays within API's 20MB inline request limit.

models.description: Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash via OpenRouter with vision
models._limits_note: 3000 images/prompt, 7MB per image. 15MB original size limit to ensure base64-encoded payload (~20MB after +33% encoding) stays within API's 20MB inline request limit.

models.description: Mistral's largest model (text-only)
Meta's Llama 3 70B model (text-only)
DeepSeek R1 with thinking mode - advanced reasoning capabilities (text-only)
Perplexity's online model with web search (text-only)
OpenAI's o3 model - first reasoning model with vision, can think with images
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (200K context). No fixed image count or size limit documented in API. Released April 2025 as first reasoning model with vision capabilities.

models.description: OpenAI's o3-mini model - balanced performance and speed (text-only, no vision support)
models._limits_note: Official documentation states: 'o3-mini does not support vision capabilities'

models.description: OpenAI's o3-mini with high reasoning effort (DEPRECATED - replaced by o3/o4-mini/high, text-only)
models._limits_note: Deprecated: replaced by o3/o4-mini/high models as of 2025-04-16; no vision support documented

models.description: OpenAI's o3-pro model - professional-grade reasoning with vision capabilities
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (200K context). Enhanced version of o3 with same vision capabilities. Can reason about visual inputs.

models.description: OpenAI's o4-mini model - fast and efficient reasoning with vision, thinks with images
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (200K context). Released with o3 in April 2025 as reasoning model with 'thinking with images' capability.

models.description: OpenAI's GPT-4o - flagship multimodal model with vision capabilities
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (128K context). Supports JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP. Images processed at token level with no fixed count limit.

models.description: OpenAI's GPT-4 Turbo - enhanced GPT-4 with vision support
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (128K context). Vision support added in gpt-4-turbo-2024-04-09 and later versions.

models.description: OpenAI's ChatGPT-4o - always-updated alias to latest GPT-4o with vision
models._limits_note: Alias for latest GPT-4o. Token-based limit (128K context). Same vision capabilities as gpt-4o.

models.description: GPT-5 (400K context, 128K output) - Advanced model with vision and reasoning support
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (400K context). Future OpenAI model assumed to follow same token-based vision approach as GPT-4o.

models.description: GPT-5 Pro - Advanced reasoning model with vision (text+image input, text output)
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (400K context). Pro variant assumed to follow same token-based vision approach.

models.description: GPT-5-Codex - specialized version optimized for software engineering with vision support
models._limits_note: Token-based limit (400K context). Codex variant assumed to follow same token-based vision approach for screenshots/UI.

models.description: GPT-5-mini (400K context, 128K output) - Efficient variant with reasoning support
GPT-5 nano (400K context, 128K output) - Fastest, cheapest version of GPT-5 for summarization and classification tasks
GPT-5.1 (400K context, 128K output) - Flagship reasoning model with configurable thinking effort and vision support
GPT-5.1 Codex (400K context, 128K output) - Agentic coding specialization available through the Responses API
GPT-5.1 Codex mini (400K context, 128K output) - Cost-efficient Codex variant with streaming support
xAI's Grok 4 via OpenRouter with vision and advanced reasoning
models._limits_note: No image count limit, 20MiB per image
